meanings.definition: The quality or state of being impermeable.
meanings.sent1: The impermeability of the rubber gloves kept the water out.
meanings.sent2: The impermeability of the rock prevented any water from seeping through.
meanings.sent3: The impermeability of the umbrella saved the day during the sudden downpour.
meanings.sent4: Her mind's impermeability to new ideas was like a fortress against change.
meanings.sent5: The impermeability of the plastic wrap was so strong that not even air could pass through.

meanings.definition: The inability to be penetrated or passed through.
meanings.sent1: The impermeability of the wall made it impossible to see what was on the other side.
meanings.sent2: The impermeability of the fabric kept the spilled juice from soaking through.
meanings.sent3: The impermeability of the joke went over his head, leaving him puzzled.
meanings.sent4: The impermeability of her heart softened when she heard the heartfelt apology.
meanings.sent5: The impermeability of the barrier was like a solid wall, blocking all attempts to pass through.
